results.title: The Goodies and the beanstalk
results.creator_credit: BBC, J.H. Davies, Jim Franklin and Bob Spiers
results.brief_description: They’ll do anything, anytime, anywhere - and they’ve got the bike to prove it. Here are three episodes of classic high-brow comedy starring Tim Brooke-Taylor, Bill Oddie and Graeme Garden. THE GOODIES AND THE BEANSTALK: Cricklewood, 1973: poverty stricken, the Goodies sell their tandem for a tin of beans - which, when planted, grows into a giant beanstalk leading up Mt Everest to the giant’s castle where golden eggs are laid. But before the Goodies can become rich, they must battle with the Giant. Note: this is the 43 minute Christmas version. Guest stars Michael Aspel. THE END: The office is entombed under a pillar of concrete in line with Graeme’s new city development plan. Isolated, the Goodies explore their relationships with each other, politics, religion and eye-spy. THE BUNFIGHT AT THE O.K. TEA ROOMS: The Goodies go west (well, Cornwall) to mine for gold, but strike cream instead. Graeme monopolises the cream business by sneaking off on the other two, but Tim and Bill also find strawberry jam and scones. The stakes are set for a poker game where winner takes all, and culminates in the Bunfight at the O.K. Tea Rooms.

results.title: The Goodbye girl
results.creator_credit: Warner Bros Pictures, Ray Stark and Herbert Ross
results.brief_description: Neil Simon’s fast-paced romance set in New York City revolves around the life of Paula McFadden (Marcia Mason) and her precocious daughter Lucy (Quinn Cummings). Recently abandoned by her boyfriend, Paula soon discovers that their apartment has been sublet to Elliot Garfield, a confident and self-obsessed actor from Chicago preparing for his New York debut (Richard Dreyfuss in an Academy Award performance). As Elliot arrives to claim the apartment the hate-at-first-sight pair strike an uneasy compromise that has explosive consequences.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Warner Bros Pictures, Ray Stark and Herbert Ross

results.title: The Good, the bad and the ugly [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Produzioni Europee Associati, Alberto Grimaldi and Sergio Leone
results.brief_description: During the Civil War a mysterious nomad (Clint Eastwood) enters a macabre business partnership with a Mexican gunman (Eli Wallach), a man with a price on his head. Eastwood turns him in to the authorities, collects the reward money, and at the last minute, rescues him so that they can begin the whole process again. They make quite a good living doing this until they form an uneasy alliance with a sadistic criminal (Lee Van Cleef), and this time, the stakes are much higher. This film is the third and arguably the best of Sergio Leone’s westerns set during the Civil War. With a memorable score by Ennio Morricone and excellent cast, this is the quintessential “Spaghetti Western”.

results.title: The Good, good, good, good life
results.creator_credit: Teleketics, Karl Holtsnider and Rolf Forsberg
results.brief_description: This film serves as a plea for restraint and conservation in the use of goods and services, through the story of a self-sufficient retired man whose modern family deluge him with modern appliances, re-do his homely living room and attempt to introduce him to the “good life”.

results.title: The Good wife of Tokyo
results.creator_credit: Twentieth Century Vixen, Channel Four, Kim Longinotto and Claire Hunt
results.brief_description: When Kazuko Hohki goes back to Tokyo with her avant-garde band, the ‘Frank Chickens’, after living in England for fifteen years, she decides to marry her boyfriend of ten years to please her mother. This wryly observed documentary records her re-experiencing of Japan after a long absence, examining traditional and contemporary attitudes to women and the unconventional lives of her friends. Focusing on Kazuko’s mother and other women who have joined a religion known as ‘The House of Development’, which encourages feelings of self-confidence and individuality the film provides a fresh perspective on the lives of women in contemporary Japanese society. In Japanese with English subtitles.

results.title: The Good oil
results.creator_credit: Film Australia, Elisabeth Knight and Keith Gow
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Law”.
A funny, true to life story about a group of residents and their conflict with a nearby factory management. The residents’ indignation over sleepless nights and spoiled washing has its funny moments but the way is opened for serious questions about our changing environment

results.title: The Good news is water
results.brief_description: Outlines the work of UNICEF in providing a permanent, clear water supply to a village in Imo State in Eastern Nigeria. The installation of such a water supply will combat cholera, diarrhoea and guinea worm contracted from using contaminated water holes.

results.title: The Good food show. series 2
results.brief_description: Gabrielle Gate takes us through a series of episodes which focus not only on good eating, but good health also. The emphasis is on freshness, quality and the excellence of Australian produce. Guest chefs appear on the programs to offer the viewers a range of delicious recipes and ideas. The programs on this tape are: Fishy tales; The Humble spud; Sweet temptations and Something special.
